I had been brought in for questioning, but I had no idea what I was being accused of. The detective's words were laced with a hint of suspicion, and I could sense the weight of the investigation bearing down on me.

"I'm afraid we have reason to believe you were involved in the forgery of a valuable document," the detective said, his voice firm but not unkind. I felt a surge of panic rise up, but I tried to remain calm, my mind racing with thoughts of how this could be possible.

I had always been a law-abiding citizen, but the detective's words made me wonder if I had somehow been mistaken for someone else. I thought back to the day I had signed the document, but everything seemed normal. I had no recollection of anything out of the ordinary.

The detective's eyes narrowed, his gaze piercing through me. "We have evidence, Mr. Johnson. We know you were in the vicinity of the bank on the day the forgery took place. And we have a witness who places you at the scene."
